import sys

def get_max_monsters(n, a, b):
    """
    Returns the maximum total number of monsters the heroes can defeat.
    """
    # The first hero can defeat at most B_1 monsters attacking the first town and A_1 monsters attacking the second town.
    # The last hero can defeat at most B_N monsters attacking the last town and A_{N+1} monsters attacking the second-to-last town.
    # The i-th hero can defeat at most B_i monsters attacking the i-th town and A_{i+1} monsters attacking the (i+1)-th town.
    # The maximum total number of monsters the heroes can defeat is the sum of the maximum numbers of monsters each hero can defeat.
    return b[0] + a[1] + sum([max(b[i], a[i+1]) for i in range(1, n)])

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    a = list(map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split()))
    b = list(map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split()))
    print(get_max_monsters(n, a, b))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
